comment.author: 9701538@N07
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Illinois & Michigan Canal, and we'd love to have this added to the group! this may be the I&M Canal through Lemont,as it needed to be cut thru solid limestone (the rock cut) and the stone looks aged. the cal-sag channel was dug thru palos hills,but wasn't completed until 1922. the "hill" would be consistent with the waste from the nearby drainage canal (sanitary and ship) which was parallel to the I&M thru most of it's length. my only question is the width...the I&M was only 60' wide, the drainage canal is 160-225'...hard to tell how wide this is...assuming a wide angle lens was used,i would say it is the I&M,as that rocky "ledge" still exists today in Lemont

comment.author: 18848263@N06
comment._content: That image is taken of the Drainage Canal just East of the Willow Springs Road Bridge where the canal banks turn from cut stone to earth.   This image appears to be taken from the south bank looking N/E just East of the old steel bridge.

comment.author: 93265881@N08
comment._content: Yes, its the San and Ship canal, just north of Willow Springs Rd Bridge. goo.gl/maps/gT8S7
